question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Evaluate $\cfrac{\left\lceil\cfrac{17}{7}-\left\lceil\cfrac{27}{17}\right\rceil\right\rceil}{\left\lceil\cfrac{27}{7}+\left\lceil\cfrac{7\cdot17}{27}\right\rceil\right\rceil}$
inference:
$$\cfrac{\left\lceil\cfrac{17}{7}-\left\lceil\cfrac{27}{17}\right\rceil\right\rceil}{\left\lceil\cfrac{27}{7}+\left\lceil\cfrac{7\cdot17}{27}\right\rceil\right\rceil}=\cfrac{\left\lceil\cfrac{17}{7}-\left\lceil\cfrac{27}{17}\right\rceil\right\rceil}{\left\lceil\cfrac{27}{7}+\left\lceil\cfrac{119}{27}\right\rceil\right\rceil}=\cfrac{\left\lceil\cfrac{17}{7}-2\right\rceil}{\left\lceil\cfrac{27}{7}+5\right\rceil}=\cfrac{\left\lceil1\right\rceil}{\left\lceil7\right\rceil}=\cfrac{1}{7}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\cfrac{1}{7}}.$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The first thing to be addressed is the fractions under the inner sets of ceiling functions. The smallest integer greater than $\frac{27}{17}$ is $2$. The smallest integer greater than $\frac{7\cdot17}{27}$, which is equal to $\frac{119}{27}$ is $5$. Therefore, the original problem can be rewritten as: \[\frac{\left\lceil\frac{17}{7}-2\right\rceil}{\left\lceil\frac{27}{7}+5\right\rceil}=\frac{\left\lceil\frac{3}{7}\right\rceil}{\left\lceil\frac{62}{7}\right\rceil}\] The smallest integer greater than $\frac{3}{7}$ is $1$ and the smallest integer greater than $\frac{62}{7}$ is $9$. Hence, the final simplified fraction is $\boxed{\frac{1}{9}}$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{\cfrac{1}{7}}.$ I hope it is correct.
